posts.name: Landon
posts.cooked: Does any have example code of how  to use the data log function on a double data information. I tried using what was on WPIlib, but could not seem to get that to work. Does anyone have code that I could base from to collect data with the input number with it in the data sheet.

posts.name: Fletch
posts.cooked: Could you describe what you tried and in what way it’s not working?

posts.name: Landon
Ryan Blue
posts.cooked:
The LogEntry objects that you create in robotInit are meant to be used to send values to the log. To actually log data, you’ll have to call (for example) myDoubleLog.append(5) , where 5 is the value you are logging.

DataLogManager will also record all NetworkTables values in the log by default as well, so if you add items to NetworkTables through SmartDashboard, Shuffleboard, or the NT api, they will be recorded in the log.

posts.name: Landon
posts.cooked: So what you are saying if you init the logging table then it will record in a table all data going into the smart dashboard?

posts.name: Landon
posts.cooked: So do you have an example code of putting data going to the smart dashboard into a table?

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: If you simply add DataLogManager.start() to your robotInit, everything in NT will get logged.  So if you later do SmartDashboard.putNumber("foo", 5); it will end up in the log file, no extra step required.  When you load the log file in DataLogTool for export, you’ll see all the NT topics in there.
